hand.upgraded: Place 1 common piece of your color on any empty square.
hand.pieces: You may do 1 combat move or 2 standard moves, using your non-legendary pieces.

hand.name: Earth Elemental
hand.text: Destroy a non-legendary piece on or adjacent to a red square. Then upgrade a common piece on or adjacent to a green square. Then the Earth Elemental may do 1 combat move to an adjacent red or green square.

hand.name: Angel of Death
hand.text: You may choose any 1 piece other than the Angel of Death: Upgrade it and then do a combat leap onto its square with the Angel of Death.

hand.name: Gryphon Rider
hand.text: The Gryphon Rider may do a combat leap. If she does, you may then downgrade her and place 1 common piece of your color on an empty adjacent space.

hand.name: Cannon
hand.text: You may choose 1 of the indicated directions: Destroy all common pieces in that direction.

hand.name: Messenger
hand.text: You may choose 1 of your non-legendary pieces and a direction. That piece may do any number of standard moves in that direction.

discard.name: Chronicler
discard.text: Upgrade 1 of your common pieces other than the Chronicler. Then that piece may do a standard move.

discard.name: Champion
discard.text: You may destroy 1 adjacent enemy piece. If that piece was legendary, you also destroy the Champion and gain an action.

discard.name: Assassin
discard.text: Destroy any piece on the marked square. If the marked square was empty, the Assassin may move onto it.

discard.name: High Priestess
discard.text: The High Priestess may do 1 standard move. Whether she moves or not, you may then upgrade 1 common piece adjacent to her.

discard.name: Summoner
discard.text: You may place up to 2 common pieces of your color on empty marked squares.

discard.name: Time Mage
discard.text: Gain an action. If there is an enemy piece on the marked square, destroy it.

discard.name: Master of Intrigue
discard.text: Do up to 3 moves: standard moves with the Master of Intrigue and/or combat moves using non-legendary pieces that were used to summon him.

discard.name: Infantry Captain
discard.text: Do up to 2 combat moves, using your pieces other than the Infantry Captain.

discard.name: Herald
discard.text: Do up to 2 moves, using only your pieces. These moves can only be onto empty squares.

discard.name: Swordmaster
discard.text: You may destroy 1 common enemy piece on a diagonally adjacent square. If you do, upgrade the Swordmaster.

160.name: Heroic Devastation
160.text: You destroyed at least 4 enemy pieces this turn, at least 2 of them upgraded.

162.name: Isolation
162.text: An enemy piece is within 2 squares of another enemy piece, but it cannot get adjacent to any enemy piece in 3 or fewer moves through empty squares.

165.name: Corner Chain
165.text: Squares in two opposite corners of the board are connected by a chain of your pieces.

151.name: Heroic Destruction
151.text: You destroyed at least 3 enemy pieces this turn, at least 1 of them upgraded.

158.name: Devastation
158.text: You destroyed at least 4 enemy pieces this turn.

159.name: Green Summoning
159.text: You summoned at least 2 beings this turn, at least 1 on a green square.

161.name: Central Dominance
161.text: You have at least 5 pieces on the nine central squares, and at least 2 of them are upgraded.

166.name: Line Dominance
166.text: On one of the orthogonal lines through the central squares, you have 6 more pieces than your opponent does.

173.name: Color Conquest
173.text: You have at least 5 pieces on red and/or green squares, and at least 3 of them are upgraded.

156.name: Imprisonment
156.text: You have at least 6 pieces adjacent to the same enemy piece.

167.name: Colored Summoning
167.text: You summoned at least 2 beings on red and/or green squares this turn. (Both of them may have been summoned on the same square.)
